response.name: Secret Text
response.description: Select this option if you want a string (like a password) to be encrypted
response.yaml:
---
type: SecretText
valueType: Inline
name: secret_name
description: 'secret description'
identifier: secret_identifier
account: account_identifier
secretManager: harness-vault
tags:
  - tag1
  - tag2

response.name: Secret File
response.description: Select this option if you want a file (like a certificate) to be encrypted
response.yaml:
# Secret's scope. Allowed values are project | account | organization. REQUIRED
scope: project

# Identifier of the project to which this secret belongs to. REQUIRED if scope is project
project: commerceApp

# Identifier of the organization to which this secret belongs to. REQUIRED if scope is organization
organization: commerce

# Non-changeable identifier of the connector, can not contain spaces or special chars. REQUIRED
identifier: awsQAAccount

# Name of the connector. OPTIONAL. If not specified, identifier will be used as name
name: AWS QA account

# Description text. OPTIONAL
description: description of secret

# Key-value pair tags. OPTIONAL
tags:
  businessUnit: ecommerce
  group: ci
# Identifier of the secret manager connector. The identifier for Harness built-in secret manager is "harness-secret-manager"
secretManager: my-vault

# Secret type. See Secret Types for list of all Secret Types supported. text | file. REQUIRED.
type: text

# Spec based on the secret type. Example spec for type "text"
spec:
  # Value type can be in line or reference to the secret
  value-type: in-line
  value: 'mysecret'
